title: Sick mum-of-five jailed for making and selling child abuse videos of daughters

A mum-of-five filmed sickening child abuse videos of her own daughters and sold them on the internet, police believe.

The 35-year-old mother, from Sweden, was sentenced six years in prison by a Swedish court after her arrest by Guardia Civil in Benalmadena on Spain's Costa del Sol.

Swedish police believed she was one of three women who exploited their own children to produce paedophile material for sale.

Two other women have since been arrested and jailed in Sweden, according to EuroWeekly .

(Image: Guardia Civil)

(Image: Guardia Civil)

Swedish police contacted Europol and conducted an international investigation named Operation Kasino to hunt for the mother and four of her five children.

They traced the family first to Malta and then to Spain where she was eventually apprehended.

During the arrest, officials busted into the mother's home in Benalmadena and found sex toys and costumes in the luggage.

They also confiscated video-making equipment including a laptop and cameras.

The suspect was then put on handcuffs and taken out of the property.

Guardia Civil believed she had sexually abused two of her daughters, aged 14 and eight.

(Image: Guardia Civil)

(Image: Guardia Civil)

Her three daughters - aged 14, 8 and 5 - and a 13-year-old son have been taken into Spanish social services before relocating to foster homes in Sweden.

The suspect was extradited to Sweden and imprisoned for six years.

Three men have also been jailed after investigators found them guilty of buying the child abuse video, the Guardia Civil revealed on Wednesday.
